member.name: T:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection
member.summary: A pooled asynchronous connection to a SQLite database.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteAsyncConnection and opens a pooled SQLite database specified by databasePath.
member.param: Specifies the path to the database file.

Specifies whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false). You absolutely do want to store them as Ticks in all new projects. The value of false is only here for backwards compatibility. There is a *significant* speed advantage, with no down sides, when setting storeDateTimeAsTicks = true. If you use DateTimeOffset properties, it will be always stored as ticks regardingless the storeDateTimeAsTicks parameter.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.#ctor(System.String,SQLite.SQLiteOpenFlags,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteAsyncConnection and opens a pooled SQLite database specified by databasePath.
member.param: Specifies the path to the database file.
Flags controlling how the connection should be opened. Async connections should have the FullMutex flag set to provide best performance.

Specifies whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false). You absolutely do want to store them as Ticks in all new projects. The value of false is only here for backwards compatibility. There is a *significant* speed advantage, with no down sides, when setting storeDateTimeAsTicks = true. If you use DateTimeOffset properties, it will be always stored as ticks regardingless the storeDateTimeAsTicks parameter.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.#ctor(SQLite.SQLiteConnectionString)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteAsyncConnection and opens a pooled SQLite database using the given connection string.
member.param: Details on how to find and open the database.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DatabasePath
member.summary: Gets the database path used by this connection.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.LibVersionNumber
member.summary: Gets the SQLite library version number. 3007014 would be v3.7.14

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DateTimeStringFormat
member.summary: The format to use when storing DateTime properties as strings. Ignored if StoreDateTimeAsTicks is true.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.GetBusyTimeout
member.summary: The amount of time to wait for a table to become unlocked.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.SetBusyTimeoutAsync(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the amount of time to wait for a table to become unlocked.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.EnableWriteAheadLoggingAsync
member.summary: Enables the write ahead logging. WAL is significantly faster in most scenarios by providing better concurrency and better disk IO performance than the normal journal mode. You only need to call this function once in the lifetime of the database.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.StoreDateTimeAsTicks
member.summary: Whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false).

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.StoreTimeSpanAsTicks
member.summary: Whether to store TimeSpan properties as ticks (true) or strings (false).

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.Trace
member.summary: Whether to writer queries to during execution.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.Tracer
member.summary: The delegate responsible for writing trace lines.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.TimeExecution
member.summary: Whether Trace lines should be written that show the execution time of queries.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.TableMappings
member.summary: Returns the mappings from types to tables that the connection currently understands.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.ResetPool
member.summary: Closes all connections to all async databases. You should *never* need to do this. This is a blocking operation that will return when all connections have been closed.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.GetConnection
member.summary: Gets the pooled lockable connection used by this async connection. You should never need to use this. This is provided only to add additional functionality to SQLite-net. If you use this connection, you must use the Lock method on it while using it.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.CloseAsync
member.summary: Closes any pooled connections used by the database.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.EnableLoadExtensionAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable extension loading.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.CreateTableAsync``1(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.CreateTableAsync(System.Type,SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.param: Type to reflect to a database table.
Optional flags allowing implicit PK and indexes based on naming conventions.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.CreateTablesAsync``2(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database for each type. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated for each type.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.CreateTablesAsync``3(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database for each type. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated for each type.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.CreateTablesAsync``4(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database for each type. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated for each type.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.CreateTablesAsync``5(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database for each type. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated for each type.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.CreateTablesAsync(SQLite.CreateFlags,System.Type[])
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database for each type. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated for each type.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DropTableAsync``1
member.summary: Executes a "drop table" on the database. This is non-recoverable.

member.summary: Executes a "drop table" on the database. This is non-recoverable.
member.param: The TableMapping used to identify the table.

member.summary: Creates an index for the specified table and column.

Name of the column to index
Whether the index should be unique

member.summary: Creates an index for the specified table and column.

Name of the database table
Name of the column to index
Whether the index should be unique

member.summary: Creates an index for the specified table and columns.
member.param: Name of the database table

Whether the index should be unique

member.summary: Creates an index for the specified table and columns.

Name of the database table
An array of column names to index
Whether the index should be unique

member.typeparam: Type to reflect to a database table.
member.param: Property to index
Whether the index should be unique

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.InsertAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts the given object and (and updates its auto incremented primary key if it has one).
member.param: The object to insert.
member.returns: The number of rows added to the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.InsertAsync(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Inserts the given object (and updates its auto incremented primary key if it has one). The return value is the number of rows added to the table.
member.param: The object to insert.
The type of object to insert.
member.returns: The number of rows added to the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.InsertAsync(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Inserts the given object (and updates its auto incremented primary key if it has one). The return value is the number of rows added to the table.
member.param: The object to insert.
Literal SQL code that gets placed into the command. INSERT {extra} INTO ...
member.returns: The number of rows added to the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.InsertAsync(System.Object,System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Inserts the given object (and updates its auto incremented primary key if it has one). The return value is the number of rows added to the table.
member.param: The object to insert.
Literal SQL code that gets placed into the command. INSERT {extra} INTO ...
The type of object to insert.
member.returns: The number of rows added to the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.InsertOrReplaceAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts the given object (and updates its auto incremented primary key if it has one). The return value is the number of rows added to the table. If a UNIQUE constraint violation occurs with some pre-existing object, this function deletes the old object.
member.param: The object to insert.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.InsertOrReplaceAsync(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Inserts the given object (and updates its auto incremented primary key if it has one). The return value is the number of rows added to the table. If a UNIQUE constraint violation occurs with some pre-existing object, this function deletes the old object.
member.param: The object to insert.
The type of object to insert.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.UpdateAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Updates all of the columns of a table using the specified object except for its primary key. The object is required to have a primary key.
member.param: The object to update. It must have a primary key designated using the PrimaryKeyAttribute.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.UpdateAsync(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Updates all of the columns of a table using the specified object except for its primary key. The object is required to have a primary key.
member.param: The object to update. It must have a primary key designated using the PrimaryKeyAttribute.
The type of object to insert.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.UpdateAllAsync(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates all specified objects.
member.param: An of the objects to insert.
A boolean indicating if the inserts should be wrapped in a transaction

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DeleteAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Deletes the given object from the database using its primary key.
member.param: The object to delete. It must have a primary key designated using the PrimaryKeyAttribute.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DeleteAsync``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Deletes the object with the specified primary key.
member.param: The primary key of the object to delete.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DeleteAsync(System.Object,SQLite.TableMapping)
member.summary: Deletes the object with the specified primary key.
member.param: The primary key of the object to delete.
The TableMapping used to identify the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DeleteAllAsync``1
member.summary: Deletes all the objects from the specified table. WARNING WARNING: Let me repeat. It deletes ALL the objects from the specified table. Do you really want to do that?
member.typeparam: The type of objects to delete.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DeleteAllAsync(SQLite.TableMapping)
member.summary: Deletes all the objects from the specified table. WARNING WARNING: Let me repeat. It deletes ALL the objects from the specified table. Do you really want to do that?
member.param: The TableMapping used to identify the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.BackupAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Backup the entire database to the specified path.
member.param: Path to backup file.
The name of the database to backup (usually "main").

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.GetAsync``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve an object with the given primary key from the table associated with the specified type. Use of this method requires that the given type have a designated PrimaryKey (using the PrimaryKeyAttribute).
member.param: The primary key.
member.returns: The object with the given primary key. Throws a not found exception if the object is not found.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.GetAsync(System.Object,SQLite.TableMapping)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve an object with the given primary key from the table associated with the specified type. Use of this method requires that the given type have a designated PrimaryKey (using the PrimaryKeyAttribute).
member.param: The primary key.
The TableMapping used to identify the table.
member.returns: The object with the given primary key. Throws a not found exception if the object is not found.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.GetAsync``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve the first object that matches the predicate from the table associated with the specified type.
member.param: A predicate for which object to find.
member.returns: The object that matches the given predicate. Throws a not found exception if the object is not found.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.FindAsync``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve an object with the given primary key from the table associated with the specified type. Use of this method requires that the given type have a designated PrimaryKey (using the PrimaryKeyAttribute).
member.param: The primary key.
member.returns: The object with the given primary key or null if the object is not found.

member.param: The primary key.
The TableMapping used to identify the table.
member.returns: The object with the given primary key or null if the object is not found.

member.returns: The object that matches the given predicate or null if the object is not found.

member.summary: Retrieves the mapping that is automatically generated for the given type.

Optional flags allowing implicit PK and indexes based on naming conventions

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.GetMappingAsync``1(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Retrieves the mapping that is automatically generated for the given type.

member.returns: The mapping represents the schema of the columns of the database and contains methods to set and get properties of objects.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.GetTableInfoAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Query the built-in sqlite table_info table for a specific tables columns.
member.returns: The columns contains in the table.
member.param: Table name.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.ExecuteAsync(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. Use this method instead of Query when you don't expect rows back. Such cases include INSERTs, UPDATEs, and DELETEs. You can set the Trace or TimeExecution properties of the connection to profile execution.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: The number of rows modified in the database as a result of this execution.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.InsertAllAsync(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts all specified objects.
member.param:
An of the objects to insert.
A boolean indicating if the inserts should be wrapped in a transaction.
member.returns: The number of rows added to the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.InsertAllAsync(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts all specified objects.
member.param: An of the objects to insert.
Literal SQL code that gets placed into the command. INSERT {extra} INTO ...
A boolean indicating if the inserts should be wrapped in a transaction.
member.returns: The number of rows added to the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.InsertAllAsync(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts all specified objects.
member.param: An of the objects to insert.
The type of object to insert.
A boolean indicating if the inserts should be wrapped in a transaction.
member.returns: The number of rows added to the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.RunInTransactionAsync(System.Action{SQLite.SQLiteConnection})
member.summary: Executes within a (possibly nested) transaction by wrapping it in a SAVEPOINT. If an exception occurs the whole transaction is rolled back, not just the current savepoint. The exception is rethrown.
member.param: The to perform within a transaction. can contain any number of operations on the connection but should never call or .

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.Table``1
member.summary: Returns a queryable interface to the table represented by the given type.
member.returns: A queryable object that is able to translate Where, OrderBy, and Take queries into native SQL.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.ExecuteScalarAsync``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. Use this method when return primitive values. You can set the Trace or TimeExecution properties of the connection to profile execution.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: The number of rows modified in the database as a result of this execution.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.QueryAsync``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the mapping automatically generated for the given type.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: A list with one result for each row returned by the query.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.QueryScalarsAsync``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns the first column of each row of the result.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: A list with one result for the first column of each row returned by the query.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.QueryAsync(SQLite.TableMapping,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the specified mapping. This function is only used by libraries in order to query the database via introspection. It is normally not used.
member.param: A to use to convert the resulting rows into objects.
The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DeferredQueryAsync``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the mapping automatically generated for the given type.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query. The enumerator will call sqlite3_step on each call to MoveNext, so the database connection must remain open for the lifetime of the enumerator.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DeferredQueryAsync(SQLite.TableMapping,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the specified mapping. This function is only used by libraries in order to query the database via introspection. It is normally not used.
member.param: A to use to convert the resulting rows into objects.
The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query. The enumerator will call sqlite3_step on each call to MoveNext, so the database connection must remain open for the lifetime of the enumerator.

member.name: T:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionWithLock
member.summary: This is a normal connection except it contains a Lock method that can be used to serialize access to the database in lieu of using the sqlite's FullMutex support.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Connection string containing the DatabasePath.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionWithLock.SkipLock
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this skip lock.
member.value: true if skip lock; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionWithLock.Lock
member.summary: Lock the database to serialize access to it. To unlock it, call Dispose on the returned object.
